snippet: The organization called the problem “a growing challenge for countries seeking to close the immunization gap.”
abstract: World Health Organization warns of rising global ‘vaccine hesitancy,' practice where people delay or refuse vaccines for themselves or their children; reports one in five children do not receive routine immunizations and 1.5 million children die yearly from diseases vaccines could have prevented.
lead_paragraph: The organization called the problem “a growing challenge for countries seeking to close the immunization gap.”

headline.main: W.H.O. Calls ‘Vaccine Hesitancy’ an Increasing Concern Globally
